title: OKTA Access Expires - Timeout Initiated Logout - Navigate from HomeTab to TicketsTab
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user is logged in and on the HomeTab
custom_steps: WHEN the user token is expired
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be logged out 
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user logs in with their MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user is on the Home tab w/ tickets for a future event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND Home Tab page displays with all information including Tickets on it

custom_steps_separated.content: [AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

WHEN the user access token expires
AND the user navigates to Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be logged out 
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]


ANDROID: 
THEN the user will be logged out 
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in (with a refreshed access token)
AND the user is able to view the tickets on the account

You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

title: Okta Access Expires While in Background
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user is logged in and on the HomeTab
AND user has backgrounded the Ballpark app
custom_steps:
GIVEN Okta access token expires while app is in background
WHEN app is resumed from background
custom_expected:
THEN the user requires to login again
AND the app gets new access token with the new login

You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user is logged in
AND User is on Tickets Tab
custom_steps:
WHEN Okta access token expires
AND user performs a pull to refresh (or button tap of 'Refresh')

THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

THEN the user will be logged out

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow)

title: Okta Access Expires while User has No Network
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a logged in user with upcoming tickets

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user logs in with their MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user is on the Home tab w/ tickets for a future event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND Home Tab page displays with all information including Tickets on it

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN network is off (airplane mode)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user remains logged in and can access offline tickets

[Android: you may see a Snackbar when on Ticket list view "Something went wrong, try again" and a dialog message on Ticket scan view "Ticket Details Unavailable" but you will still be able to access the Ticket's scan view]

With new Home V1: No network message display on Home

custom_steps_separated.content: [AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

WHEN network is still off (airplane mode)
AND access token has expired
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user remains logged in and can access offline tickets (prior to re-establishing network)

[Android: you may see a Snackbar when on Ticket list view "Something went wrong, try again" and a dialog message on Ticket scan view "Ticket Details Unavailable" but you will still be able to access the Ticket's scan view]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN network is reestablished
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

ANDROID:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in (with a refreshed access token)
AND the user is able to view the tickets on the account

title: Okta Error Refreshing Access Token and User Reset Password
custom_preconds:
Given a logged in user with upcoming tickets and an expired access token, and a recently changed password

as reference: Upon initial integration with iDK, a Crash was witnessed for this use case. But has since been corrected [BP-10866](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10866 )
custom_steps: When the refresh token call fails
custom_expected:
Then the app fails to silently fetch a new access token with keychain credentials and the user is logged out


NOTE: CHANGING PW ON THE ACCT IS REQUIRED WITH THIS VALIDATION -- WOULD BE BEST TO RETURN THE PW TO ORIGINAL STATE (by reseting pw two more times to allow revert back to original) OR NOTE THE NEW PASSWORD CHANGE TO OTHERS

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND Home Tab page displays with all information including Tickets on it

custom_steps_separated.content:
[AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

using Computer: (within the 6 min expiration)
WHEN user logs into the acct in QA MLB (https://qa-gcp.mlb.com/account )* 
AND user changes the password


*note: if having issues with QA MLB acct page to work, attempt on an incognito browser
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user has updated password (via change from mlb.com)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user access token expires
AND the user navigates to Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow using former password)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is unable to log in (because pw has been changed)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again with updated password
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in (with a refreshed access token)
AND the user is able to view the tickets on the account

custom_steps_separated.content: NOTE: CHANGING PW ON THE ACCT IS REQUIRED WITH THIS VALIDATION -- WOULD BE BEST TO RETURN THE PW TO ORIGINAL STATE (by reseting pw two more times to allow revert back to original) OR NOTE THE NEW PASSWORD CHANGE TO OTHERS

title: Error Messaging: Login Error vs Network Error
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user tries to login to Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user types in bad credentials to login
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app should display the error:

[iOS] "Unable to log in - email and password do not match."
[Android] "Login Failed - Invalid Email and password" - IDK2.21 
[Android]"Unable to log in - email and password do not match." - IDK 4

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is in Airplane mode AND types in credentials to login
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app should display 

[iOS] "Sorry, check your network and try again"
[Android] "Login Failed - Please check your network connection and try again"

title: [Android] App Update (IDK 2.x BP v. update to IDK 4.x Bp V.)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User BP app installed(13.6.X or before) on the IDK Version 2.x 
AND User is logged In 
AND App is closed
custom_steps: WHEN User update the BP app (13.7.X or grater) on the IDK Version 4.x
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to successfully update the app 
AND user is still authenticated
AND user able to launch the app 
AND user is on the home screen

title: OKTA Access Expires - Timeout Initiated Logout
custom_preconds:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~300 seconds (5 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than that, the refresh may happen automatically.
You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user has logged in
custom_steps: WHEN the user loses network access (goes offline)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will still have access to the Scanview of their tickets even though their access token has expired
AND 
WHEN the user obtains network access 
THEN their tickets will be updated using a newly refreshed access token

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN navigates to a tickets view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user remains logged in and can access offline tickets
[Android: you may see a Snackbar when on Ticket list view "Something went wrong, try again" and a dialog message on Ticket scan view "Ticket Details Unavailable" but you will still be able to access the Ticket's scan view]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user goes back online
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app refreshes the access token and the user is able to open updated tickets

title: Okta Access Expires - User remains logged in upon Token Refresh
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES: 
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~300 seconds (5 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than that, the refresh may happen automatically.
You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user is logged in and on the HomeTab
custom_steps: WHEN the access token expires (wait at least 5 minutes) and the user navigates to Tickets Tab
custom_expected: THEN the app uses the refresh token and gets a new access token without requiring the user to login so service calls are successful

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs in with their MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is logged in
AND the user is on the Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Home Tab page displays with all information including Tickets on it

custom_steps_separated.content: [AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

WHEN the user access token expires 
AND the user navigates to Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app uses the refresh token and gets a new access token without requiring the user to login so service calls are successful (use Charles, Proxyman, or DataDog to Test this step)

title: Okta Access Expires While in Background
custom_preconds: GIVEN Okta access token expires while app is in background
custom_steps: WHEN app is resumed from background
custom_expected: THEN app gets new access token without requiring the user to login again

title: Okta Access Expires Prior to Pull to Refresh
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User is on Tickets Tab
AND Okta access token expires
custom_steps: WHEN user does a pull to refresh (or button tap of 'Refresh')
custom_expected:
THEN app gets a new access token and the service call is successful

WIKI link:https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/INFOSEC/pages/5104415/Okta+-+Steps+to+Setup+Okta+Verify+for+Workday

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is in the today tab 
AND Okta token expires
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN refresh the Tickets Tab page and check the service call in Charles
AND after app gets a new access token, the service call is successful

title: Okta Error Refreshing Access Token
custom_preconds: Given a user is logged in and the access token expires
custom_steps: WHEN an error occurs getting a new access token
custom_expected: THEN the user remains logged in

title: Upgrading with an Expired Access Token (N/A for Both platform so DO NOT NEED TO TEST)
custom_preconds:
Given a user with the previous version of the app installed and the appâ€™s access token has expired


*ANDROID [BPA-6341](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6341) - Configurable threshold for logging out users with expired access tokens
THE FOLLOWING ONLY APPLIES TO ANDROID (introduced with BP 11.0.1)
Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "max_token_refresh_attempts" as needed to force behavior. 
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user installs the latest version of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS]
Then the user does not have to log back in
AND Home tab shows data targeted to the user
AND Inbox messages update as expected

[ANDROID]
Then the user may be logged back in, BUT may see failed to connect messages within BP app pages upon exhausting the configured refresh attempts 
AND after exhausting refresh attempts, the user is returned to Welcome page to login again

title: Okta Access Expires while User has No Network
custom_preconds: Given a logged in user with upcoming tickets and an expired access token, who is offline
custom_steps: When the user opens tickets from the home tab
custom_expected:
Then the user remains logged in and can access offline tickets
[Android: you may see a Snackbar when on Ticket list view "Something went wrong, try again" and a dialog message on Ticket scan view "Ticket Details Unavailable" but you will still be able to access the Ticket's scan view]

title: Okta Error Refreshing Access Token and User Reset Password
custom_preconds: Given a logged in user with upcoming tickets and an expired access token, and a recently changed password
custom_steps: When the refresh token call fails
custom_expected: Then the app fails to silently fetch a new access token with keychain credentials and the user is logged out

title: Okta Network vs Login error
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user tries to login to Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user types in bad credentials to login
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app should display the error:

[iOS] "Unable to log in - email and password do not match."
[Android] "Login Failed - Invalid Email and password"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is in Airplane mode AND types in credentials to login
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app should display 

[iOS] "Sorry, check your network and try again"
[Android] "Login Failed - Please check your network connection and try again"
